DOC.criteria: Females 4075 year age old child bear potential . Defined female hysterectomy oophorectomy , bilateral tubal ligation postmenopausal ( natural surgically > 1 year since last menstruation ) .OR Female subject childbearing potential must agree use medically approve method birth control negative urine pregnancy test result BMI 25.0 kg/m2 29.9 kg/m2 Agrees comply study procedure Healthy determine laboratory result , medical history physical exam Has give voluntary , write , inform consent participate study Gastrointestinal distress various fatty food determine modified GSRS questionnaire Family history gallbladder disease previous history gallbladder attack Has normal rest heart rate 5080bpm Women pregnant , breastfeeding , plan become pregnant course trial Unstable psychiatric disorder require hospitalization within past 6 month Use prescription medication , counter medication natural health products/dietary supplement know affect gastric/gastrointestinal function within 4 week randomization Presence gallstone determine ultrasound Uncontrolled hypertension define untreated systolic blood pressure > 160 mmHg and/or diastolic blood pressure > 100 mmHg Clinically significant abnormal laboratory result screen include : AST , ALT and/or bilirubin > 2 x ULN ; Serum creatinine > 1.5 x ULN eGFR < 60 ; Hemoglobin < 123 g/L Participation clinical research trial within 30 day prior randomization Allergy sensitivity test article ingredient , soy , dairy , egg , wheat , peanut , tree nut , fish shellfish .
